title: Business & Finance
text:
About 900,000 workers filed for unemployment benefits last week as the labor market struggles to recover this winter.

---

The Fed said all 12 regional bank presidents and their current seconds-in-command are approved for new five-year terms.

---

IBM expects to return to revenue growth this year, even as customer caution during the pandemic drove a 4.6% sales drop in 2020.

---

The Nasdaq rose 0.5% and the S&P 500 eked out a 0.03% gain, both closing at records. The Dow slipped 0.04%.

---

BYD, a Chinese electric-car maker backed by Warren Buffett , raised $3.9 billion from a stock sale.

---

China's big telecom carriers asked the New York Stock Exchange to rethink their planned delisting.

---

Wall Street is launching a third ETF that invests in special-purpose acquisition companies.

---

Instacart plans to cut about 1,900 in-store shopping jobs, according to a letter an attorney for the company sent to a union branch.

---

Fidelity Investments ' Kathleen Murphy will retire later this year as president of the money manager's personal-investing business.
